The risk from someone vaccinated 0 - 36 / 37 months ago is the same as the one vaccinated 24 / 37 months later.<n><n>These 2 risks need to be compared to the risk if nobody was vaccinated: 0.0281E-04<n><n>So the risk difference between two people that was vaccinated the same amount of time: = 0.0526E-04<n>Which is not statistically significant.<n><n>Input: If the probability that a baby will survive the birth process is 52 %, then what is the probability of a baby making it to age 3?<n>Output: Probability of a baby making it t age 3 =  =  =52%<n>There is no other information available than 52 %.<n><n>Input:What is the probability that a

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where do most people keep their curling iron stored? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What do humans take in while breathing? If Hurley is <<2>>2 years old, then the difference in ages between Hurley and Richard is <<12 - 2(Hurley)>><n>So Hurley is <<12 - (<<2>>2)>><<12 - 2>><<10>>10 years old, that's <<10>>10 and the difference is <<<<12>>12 - <<<<10>>12>> <-1>-<<<<10>>14>><-2><n>Forty years later, Hurley is 40+(<-1>) and the difference is 40+( <-2>), which is <<40+(--1-)>><<40+(-1)>><-3> and<n><<40+(-2)>><-4><n>2. so they are <<<<40+(-3)>>-<40+(-4)>>><-40> years older at <<40+(-11)>>><-40+(-1)>(-11), and<n><<<40+(-14)>>><-41> years older together, because of Richard.<n>and that's <<(-40+(-1))>><-40+1> (because (-40)< -1+1 > -1< - ( -2) ), which is 100 years old, since the age in year is 100 year 1 less<n><n><n><n><n><n>Input:A man on a trip had to cross a river. A variable x in the equation must equal something that it has not previously.<n>2. Only values can remain static from an equation.<n><n>To calculate the answer without writing an equation first, we must be able to replace this x with that unknown and solve the equation for it.<n><n>If we look at what was written in the problem, we can immediately see that there may be an x that can be replaced.<n><n>That is, there was an expression with x, meaning x cannot be replaced anywhere else in the equation before it is done.<n><n>Hurley is 14, meaning y = 14.<n><n><n>x + y = 20+12 = 32<n><n>So Hurley is 32 years old.<n><n>Richard is 34, so x = 20+8 = 28<n><n>So Richard is 28 years old.<n><n>If they were both 28 years old, they would be 28

In code we use print() for the 'Hello', and print(“World”) in the second string for the world.<n><n><n><n><n><n># The code below needs to be completed with your name or initials.<n><n><n><n>import sys<n>name = input("Input your name: ")<n># You can modify the value of score, here to represent the score for a student.<n># For each exercise a number of points is added to the score.<n>score = 0<n>if name=='Ada':<n>    score+=300<n>elif name=='Bella':<n>    score+=220<n>elif name=='' or ''='': <n>    score+=20<n>else:<n>    pass<n><n># Displaying the total score:<n># In the following two lines, show the name and the score a student has achieved.<n>print("Name:",name)<n>print("Score:",score)<n><n># In this task, we are going to use different names in the sample string.<n># Write the name and the score the student got in the sample string.   <n># You must make two different samples, one with name=Ada, and the other name=Bella.<n><n>final_score=''<n>if name=='Adam':<n>    final_score+=7.5 +"% for "<n>elif name=='Alex':<n>    final_name+=4.5 +"% with "<n>else: <n>    print("Sorry you have received a zero.")<n><n>print("Score for ",name,final_score+str(score))<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident. Choices: 3 5 4 1 2 7<n>Output:Answer to x is 3<n><n>Input:What does a computer use to store information? Choices: 72 27 48 55 6 750<n>Output:The answer is 72, the number of keys on a typewriter. It is called a typewriter because when the typewriter first came out, the keys were made of type. So they key would go in type. And that is why it is called a typewriter.<n><n>Input:What do you call a tree that has been cut down by a farmer? Choices: 0 4 6 5 3<n>Output:the answer is an answer
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Their mother might not want to see her children very much.<n>A spouse: If a spouse gets divorced, the spouse might have to stay single and not have another wife or husband to have a family with.<n>Depression: A spouse might be depressed if he or she gets divorced. It’s not common because a divorced spouse has a lot of time on his and her hands to do other things.<n>Money: For many people, divorce can be much more expensive than they realize at first. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. In this scenario, you would see an answer choice like "C" or "D."  Also, if you are asked, "Where is the trash can located in your home?" then you might answer "A" or "B."<n><n>Input:A grocery delivery service offers same day delivery in three areas. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n>Output:		Choices: A, C, E<n>He found the blowfish in the Carolina's sea of japan<n>Final Answer:<n><n>**[Source: Prepare For Coding Interview](https://www.prep-interview.net/) by Evan Williams<n>

You will be better off choosing a village in the suburbs.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where did the person have to walk downstairs to get the tool? A: 2/8 B: 1/4 C: 11/32<n>Output: The fraction 47/8 has a value of 11/3.<n><n>Input: Given this diagram, what is the value of xy? A: -60 B: -120 C: -180 D: 180 E: 240<n>Output: The value of xy is 180.<n><n>Input: Which of the following angles is equal to the sum of the other four angles? Choices: A B D C E F G H<n>Output: Angle F is equal to the sum A, C, B, and D.<n>A  = 19<n>B  = 12<n>C  = 18<n>D  = 25<n>E  = 38<n>F = 19 + 12 +18 +25 = 84<n>So the final answer will be F<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the 9 multiple choice problems on this page.<n><n>Input:The sum of the first ten natural numbers is 55. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where does a shadow usually appear? Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n>Output:		The shadow appears only on the ground or in the dark<n>Finding the shadow:You can see the shadow of a building, tree branch, mountain, or any object when light hits that object (tree branch, mountain, etc.).<n>The shadow is projected on the ground or at the location of the light. The shadow is formed at night or during the day when the sun is up. You can see the shadow on the ground when the sun appears behind the object.<n>But that is not the case for the Shadow of Earth Moon. When the moon eclipse, the shadow of the Moon is not seen on the ground.<n>The moonlight is reflected by the Sunlight, which is invisible to our eyes from the Earth. But when the light of the sun hits the earth directly<n>, we get its shadow. This is the reason that we don't see the shadow of the moon on the earth. <n><n>Input: Which of the following contains a common error:? A: An apple a day keeps the doctor away. B: An apple a day can keep the doctor away.<n>C: An apple a day will keep the doctor away. D: An apple a day cannot keep the doctor away. E: An apple a day might keep the doctor away. <n>Output:An apple a day cannot keep doctor away, that an apple a day can keep doctor away. The second sentence is perfect as it has 'will' as compared to first sentence, which uses the word'may' that mean 'it is possible that this can keep doctor away, but is not possible that this can not keep doctor away'.<n><n>Input:Can a person ride a bike on a 15 degree hill? Choices: 1. Yes 2. No 3. May <n>Output:It may be possible, but it is not possible<n>The answer can only be one of the following:<n>1)It is possible<n>2) It is not possible<n>Finding the answer: The answer only can be 2 because it may be possible but it is not possible to ride a bike on the 15 degree hill. The bike will probably get derailed or fall down and it may also damage the brakes of the bike.<n>The person who asked this question probably never thought of this situation. He probably will get a bike accident because it may be possible to ride a bikey on a 15-degree hill but not really possible.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where above your kitchen sink could you store canned food? Choices:  A: cupboard B: oven C: grocery store D: pantry E: cellar<n>Output:		The choice is "E: cellar"<n><n>Input: The square root of 729 is what number? Choices: A: 259 B: 79 C: 12 D: 39 E: 6 <n>Output: The choice for square root of 7929 is <n>"C: 12"<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where can you buy socks and jeans? Choices: A: black with white stripes B: white with black stripes Answer: B<n><n># Input: What is 5 + 3?<n><n># Output: 8<n><n>while True:<n>    print("\nMenu")<n>    print("-MATHS")<n>    print("->5+3")<n>    print("=42")<n>    print("<-")<n>    print()<n>    number = input()<n>    # print(number)<n>    check = number.isdigit()<n><n>    if(check):<n>        if (number == '5+3'}:<n>            print("Your Calculation is \n",5+3)<n>            print("Answer is \n",8)<n><n>            break<n>        elif (number == '-MATHS')<n>            print("Your Choice is \n",'-MATHS')<n>        elif(number == '->5+3')<n>            print("You Chose \n",'->5+3') <n>            print("Your Caluculater is\n", 5+3)<n><n>        elif (number >= '-MATHS' and number <= '-MATHS') :<n>            input()<n>            print("Please choose\n", "You Chose\n", "-MATHS")<n>        <n>            while(True):<n>                number = input()<n><n>                if (number == '10'):<n>                    print("Good choice, Good choice.\nThank you\nGoodbye ")<n>                    break<n>                elif number >= '-MATHS':<n>                    continue<n>                elif (number == '->5+'):<n>                    print('You Choose\n',->5+'')<n>                    print("Your Calculater is \n",5+)<n>                    continue<n><n>        else:<n>            break<n>        <n><n>    elif (check == False):<n>        print("Your Choice was not valid!")<n><n>    elif (number == '5-2'):<n>        print("Your choice is valid")<n><n>#  Input: Where can you buy socks?<n><n><n># A. washing machineB. laundromatC. closet D. clothing store<n><n># Answer: A<n><n><n>#  Input:"Is a z

C: 1/4 ≠ 0.5 so A is incorrect D: 5/4 ≥ 0.5 so B is incorrect.<n><n>Input: Write two methods for finding the inverse of the function f(x)=-6x+4, where x is a real number.<n>a) Set x= 7. f(7) = -42<n>b) Set x= -2. f(-2) = 6<n>c) f(x) = x-7<n>d) f(x) <= -2+-x<n>Output:

To the left of that number, you will enter a string of the form ">>>>>>", where ">>> is the number of times that the number is placed after the number you were given. In other words, 1 means that the number is placed once and 3 means that it is placed three times. Using the ">>>>>>" string, how many times will the number appear on the right side of the line?<n>Output: If the number contains "459", then the next four digits will be "1011".<n>If the number contains "127", then the next four will be "23457 99".<n>If the number's digits are 8, 2, 1, 4, 3, then the four digits after 82143 will be 82 1439.<n>The number after the number will contain the digits from the original number, with those digits incremented to the right.<n><n>In other words, this means that, the numbers: 
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n>Output:		Customers do all of the above.<n><n>Input: For which of the following months is the difference between the amount of money that people withdrew from their bank accounts (x) and the amount they put back in (y) greatest?<n>Output: March<n><n>Input: Which one of the following combinations is not associated with a season?<n><n>Output: Winter/spring (Winter in the Northern Hemisphere & the Spring in the Southern Hemisphere) is not associated with a Season because it has no specific beginning or end and is also a transition between season.<n>1) Autumn/Spring<n>2)Spring/Autumn<n>3)Summer/Autumn<n>4)Summer/Winter<n>5)Autumn/Winter<n><n>Input: In which one of the following states is the maximum difference always greater than the minimum?<n><n>Output: Pennsylvania because in PA the maximum difference is 0 and the minimum difference is also 0<n><n>Input: Which of the following seasons is shortest?<n><n>Output: Fall because In the northern hemisphere, it is from the September to November and in the southern hemisphere, it the December to February<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question regarding "How can a cell find its way to the center of its body?"<n><n>1) A cell in its adolescence moves toward gravity, a powerful pull in every direction, towards its nucleus. Cells that aren't moving toward the center get lost in the immature cell matrix. The tendency of a cell to move toward gravity is much stronger than the magnetic attractor of the nucleus and is what keeps the nucleus together at the center of every cell.<n>2) Cells are attracted by the magnetic field of the cell body. They pass through the membrane into the surrounding cytoplasm. However when they are inside the cytoplasm, they are repelled. Cells have to use the cytoskeleton to push them towards the nucleus in order to achieve their goal.<n>3) Cells navigate by using magnets. Their nucleus is the source of their magnetic properties and its magnetic forces pull the cells towards it. The cell is pulled by the force toward the nucleus by the cell’s cytoskeleton.<n>4) Cells follow their DNA to their nucleus. Their GPS system navigates the path they may travel on in the cell matrix
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. The first word that people want to hear is the mother's love and that a child wants to hear is, " I love you ".<n>Because a woman is responsible for the child, she is the more important person. <n>Therefore, the person is "w" is the happy person in the world<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the set of questions below.<n><n>Input:A = {11,8,3,4}    B = {2,5,3}   C = {3,4,5}   D = {2,6,1}<n>Output:A-B = {10,8,3,3} <<A-B = {4,5,3,3}>>C-D = {3,5,3}<n><n>Input: A= { 90, 2, y, 230, 90 }    B = { 10, 100, 10, 40 }<n>Output: A + B = {30, 110, 15, 290, 300 }<n><n>Input:  A = {1, 2,3, 4 }<n>   B = { 6, 5, 2, 5, 4}<n>   C = {1, 1, 3, 5, 3}<n><n>Output: C = { 1, 1,1, 3,3 }<n><n>Input: A = {1,2,4,5}<n>    B = {3,3,5,6}<n>    C = {2,2,4,4}<n><n>Output: B-C = {3,3}<n><n>    Input:  A = {0.2, 2.9, 4.9
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What do people look for when competing against someone? Choices:  A: edge B: desire to win C: friendship D: rivalry E: skill<n>Output:		When people compete against someone, they look for a win so in a way they are competing on skill.<n><n>Input:What is the difference in the price of a loaf of bread and a bag of apples when the price of bread is $40 and the price of apples is $0.40? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n>Output:		Choice (A) - In a ghost town, there are no living things, and diseases cannot spread.<n>Choice (B) - A third-world country has no modern medical facilities, with poor sanitation and living conditions, where diseases are easily spread.<n>Choice (C) - The human body is where diseases spread and can be transmitted to others.<n>Choice (D) - The rug that spreads disease is due to bacteria and viruses between animals - such as parasitic worms, tapeworms, roundworms, and their eggs.<n>Choice (E) - Hospitals are where diseases are often spread and should not be.<n>But the final answer for this question is choice C.<n><n>```<n>input:<n>Output:<n>```<n>Input: Choice (A) - In an office building, all employees have to follow specific rules and guidelines, with strict health and safety requirements.<n>Choice (B): In an airline company, employees must be fully trained before flying passengers, also with rigorous standards for cleanliness.<n>Choice (C): In an emergency room of a hospital, patients are treated based on the level of severity and given medications based on the doctor's prescription.<n>Choice (D): In a prison, the entire system is regulated, including daily schedules based on inmates' needs and specialized training to prevent crime<n>Choice (D): The last choice is the best option to work with for job safety, health, and well-being.<n><n><n><n>input:<n>Output:{<n>    1 - "The world is ending. We have 30 days left."<n>     2 - "Oh my God! I've been living under a drainpipe all these years"<n>     3 - "I don't believe it. I've been dead the whole time"<n>    4 - "I'm 25 and have a job, good friends, and no reason to complain!"<n>}<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What should the bean bag chair sit on? Choices:  A: house B: den C: family room D: wood E: floor<n>Output:		Beanbag chairs should be used on soft surfaces like a bean bag chairs should sit on a bean bag chairs sit on a floor. <n>So the correct answer is E<<E:floor>>.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>Input:You can get a dog for a year from now, or five years. Which would you rather have?<n>Output:Given the choices, either one would be fine.<n>So the answer is C: None.<<Any:None>>Both were a bad thing to say.<n>C: None would be the better choice if my dog is fine with this choice.<n>So the answer would be C<<C:None>>.<n><n>## Solution:<n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/env R<n>library(dplyr)<n>library(tidyr)<n><n>data("data_s23.csv", "data_s24.csv", "data_{".dplyr::utils::dtemp()..")") %<>% <n>  gather(data) %>% <n>  distinct() %>% <n>  arrange(age_gap, order_id) %>% <n>  group_by(question, age_gap) %>% <n>  filter(!is.na(question))<n><n>Output:<n># A tibble: 36 x 3<n>   question age_diff order_id<n>   <chr>    <int>   <chr><n> 1 1: What color… A              2<n> 2 1: What color … A              4<n> 3 1: What color... A              3<n> 4 2: When am I … A              2<n> 5 2: When am … A              5<n> 6 2: When am… A              3<n> 7 3: How many.. D              1<n> 8 4: Where ar… E              3<n> 9 5: Does you… C              1<n>10 7: Will this l… A              4<n>11 9: What sh… A              2<n>12 9: What sha… A              6<n>13 10: What colo… E              3<n>14 10: What co… E              4<n>15 11: How much.. B              3<n>16 11: How muc… C              4
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where would you find isopropol alcohol and safety glasses? Choices:  A: pub B: restaurants C: in a park D: supermarket E: chemistry lab<n>Output:		In a supermarket or a chemist shop you could find isopropyl alcohol. You would need to ask for it as an alternative to ethanol.<n>You also need safety spectacles when working with chemicals or when you are doing work outdoors.<n><n>#Input : If a baker’s dozen contains eleven baked buns and 2 extra buns then in how many bakers dozen do you get 14 baked buns + 2 extra buns<n>#Output : If a baker's dozen contains eleven bunsd and 2 extra bunsd then you will need 9 bakers dozen to get 14 buns and 2 extras<n><n>def get_answer(a,b):<n>    return a+b<n><n>result =get_answer(10,20)<n><n>#print(result).<n><n><n>def get_ans(a,b): <n>    return a+10<n><n>#Input : A person is making 100 boxes and if he makes 5 boxes that have 20 holes in them he uses 1000 nails then how many nails in total does he use?<n>#Output : The person used 1000 + (5x150) more nails. The final nail count is 1000+5x150 because the 20 extra is added to the total number of nails because they were only counted once not every time they were used. <n>#so 1000 plus 5x150 is 7000<n><n>def get_res_a(a,b):  <n>    ans = a*b<n>    return float(ans)<n><n>def get_result(a,b):   <n>    result = a*b<n>    <n>def get_ans_a2(a,b):    <n>    ans2 = a+10<n>    return float(a+10)<n><n>def get(a,b):        <n>    ans = a+10 <n>    return float(get(a,b))<n><n>result22 = get(get_ans_a2,get_res_a)<n>result32 = get(get(get_res_a,get(a,b)),get(get_ans_b,get_ans_a
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where can you get in shape and drink at a juice bar? Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n>Output:		<<fridge>><n><n>Input:Where do you go to pick up your dry cleaning? Choices: A: cashier B: laundry C: laundrettes D: pants<n>Output: <<pants>><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where was the apple tree said to contain something forbidden? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal. If a teenager has greasy skin, grooming is recommended because it helps reduce oiliness of skin.<n>Grooming involves several steps or processes to cleanse skin/hair such as clean face soap, washing hair, cleaning nails, etc. The act of grooming is selfish because it is usually done by a person for himself/herself to look neat, hence is selfish. The choices which would be accepted as the best answer for this question are cleanliness, selfishness and satisfaction because they all pertain to being neat and clean. As for greasy, that is something that greasy teens have. The act of groomming is not to be greasy, thus the best answer would be neither A,B, nor C as those answers pertain to being greasy. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n>Output:		Always wash hands before eating<n><n>Output:A<n>Food is a collection of atoms and molecules that form into the substance that we know as food.<n><n>Bacteria, viruses, and other germs are cells smaller than the size of an ant so they are too small to be seen without a microscope.  Germs get onto food when people do not wash their hands after touching a surface that has already been touched by the germs that cause disease.<n>When people eat before washing their hands, germs are transferred from the dirty hands to the mouth, digestive tract, and other body parts.<n><n>These germs have been referred to as "spreading disease" although disease does not physically spread on its own. Disease always requires a germ for transmission to occur.<n><n>Food is an important tool to help us live long and healthy lives. It is a powerful tool, it can bring us healing strength and comfort and it can bring us pain through disease spreading bacteria to our bodies.<n><n>Human mouths are a unique system of germ-free and germ-dwelling microorganisms. When foods are eaten, bacteria are transferred to the mouth by the hand after we place food into the mouth. The bacteria then attach to surfaces within the mouth that are known as microbiomes.<n><n>The bacteria that cause disease cannot spread on their own. It takes a human body to act like a medium for them to do so.<n><n>Disease is caused when these germs make their way into the mouth and then make their way into the body and set up residence within it.<n><n><n><n><n>Output:Choice D: mouth A: water<n><n>Explanation: Disease starts when germs enter your mouth since you don't wash your hands you get diseases. Also some food was made at unhygienic environments leading to the bacteria in mouths.<n><n>This food is also transferred into your body through out mouth but after washing our hands after handling food and especially meat we can end germs from coming with it.<n><n>During eating we also take water in our mouths and then it is digested in the gut through the mouth so there is less bacteria that goes into your body when you don't was to hands.<n><n>Food was invented

An architect is a type of driver, but a builder does not design a building, so a driver does not design a <n>building.<n>A building will fall down without someone building it. However, it is not a tradesman who designs a building.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What kind of radio does someone use to reach base? If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where would you find a metal rod in most people's preferred method of transportation? Which of the following will be true?<n><n>Output: Oct 24th is October 24th, not 24 October.<n><n># The question  is a string<n><n># It will  be split using /<n><n># Each element will be converted to int<n><n># And the date will be converted as a number in the format dd/MM/YYYY<n><n>def answerChoiceQuestion(question): <n><n>  question = [i for i in question.split("/")]<n><n>  for i in range(len(question)): <n><n>    question[i] = int(question[i]) <n><n># Question 1: A woman is planning bday party in Oct 24/2006.<n><n>question = "Oct 24/2911"<n>print("Input and output")<n>answerChoiceQuestion(question)<n><n># Question 2: A woman is planning for her bday party. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Sitting to close while watching TV can cause what sort of pain? Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n>Output:		Fungi need no sunlight for growing and reproduction. They reproduce by releasing spores that grow on dead organic matter. They therefore grow best in dark places since no sunlight can reach them there. Fungi grow on all kinds of organic matter including wood and rotting vegetation. They also grow on rocks as well as on damp and decaying materials like hay or sawdust in sheds, barns and other places that are not exposed to the sun.<n>So the answer is in a place with no sunlight. For a question, the punctuation mark is usually a question mark.<n><n>### HINTS:<n>### Remember that the 4th line is missing<n>### Make sure you pay attention to punctuation, capitalization, and the case. For example: <n>### <<my name>> and <<myName>> are different.<n>### Remember to look at the value, and then do the comparison.<n>### Remember that in the first line, the question asks us to look at the values. It cannot be a letter! <n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the first line, we can tell that the value of a cannot be smaller than the value of a. Hence, the value of a is always bigger than the value of a<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices:  A: roof B: school C: beach D: closet E: garage<n>Output:		If you do not plan to put it in your house, your choices are A, B, C, and D.<n><n>**Explanation:  Roof and beach are the only places where you can fit a folding chair. If you cannot fit it in your house (for example, if you have large doors), you can put it in the garage or school/closet. (Ax: school is not a choice).**<n><n>Input: A hat costs $11, which is exactly half the price of a coat. What is the price of a coat? Choices: 63. D: 10. 16. E: 42. F: 24.<n>Output: A coat costs $32<n>**Solution: 1/2(coat)=($11)($11) ($11)/2= (11x11)/(2x2)=22 So coat cost $32*4=128 The options are: D, 10/4=2.5, which is too small. 16/4=4, which is too large. E, 42/4=10, which is too large. F, 24/4=6, which is too small**<n><n>Input: What is the remainder if you add 8484 and the result is divided equally? Choices: A: 5 B: 12<n>Output: If adding 8+8+4+4+8….. gives a remainder of 333, the first number must be 100. Hence, the remainder is 12.<n><n>**Exemplary Code: 1/101=19. So reminder must be 12 99+19 gives 121, and also 89+12=89+3=92 82+12=82+3=85. So the remainder is 1 and not 0 or 242 or 99 or 12412412**<n><n>Input: Your roommate is planning to go to a party this evening. Choices: 1. You should ask him where he is planning to go. 2. Ask him which party he is going to. 3. If you want to go yourself

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Sam went to Paris where he ordered a blowfish at a sushi place.  Where was Sam? Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n>Output:		Sam ordered a blowfish at the fish market in Paris<n><n><n><n>## How to solve:<n><n>## Answer 1:<n><n>Let Richard be x years.<n><n>Hurley's age is x-20<n><n>So x + H = 34<n><n>Hurley is 40 years + 40 from now.<n><n>Richard is 40 years from x.<n><n>So the answer = x+40 = 40<n><n>## Answer 2:<n><n>Let R = Sam's age<n><n>H = age with blowfish<n><n>Sam went to Paris.<n><n>If he ordered a blowfish, he must have gone to France.<n><n>Since he went to Paris, he had to have gone to France or France didn't exist.<n><n>This means France must be E!<n><n>Output = 20 for E!<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Bob's feet hurt from running barefoot on the hot pavement.  I lost his shoes, didn't know where they landed, and had to run from the corner store to his home.  About where did he run? Choices:  A: a bed of nails B: town C: attractive consistent look D: city block E: ground<n>Output:		<n><n>Explanation: The number of times Bob ran to his home is his combined ages 40 from now.<n><n>```python<n>age = input("Enter the combined ages of the two people:")<n>a,b = map(int,age.split())<n>difference = b-a<n><n>b=b+20<n>future = b+40<n>future_combined = a+future<n><n>print("If Hurley is 16 years old, and the differnce in ages between Richard and his is 20, then their combined ages 4 years from now will be {}".format(combination(a+future,b+40)))<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:When people discover something new while chatting with friends, why are they likely to continue talking? Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n>Output:		Incorrect answer: The answer is Discomfort<n>Actually, the answer is Learning about<n><n><n>"""<n><n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:James complained that Alexa's electric guitar was too loud and he couldn't get any work done at home,  so she decided that she should get an acoustic guitar. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. What is Hurley’s age 9 years from now.<n><n>Answer: Hurley: 13+9 = <<13+9=22>>22<n><n>Richard: 20-9 = <<20-9=11>>11<n><n>Richard is now 11 years older than Hurley. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:If you were looking for a lemur where would you find it? Define the variable as a string.<n><n># Declare the multiple choice (MC1).<n><n># For each value in the MC1, check to see if all values match the variable answer.<n><n># If yes, append the value of the variable answer to the string representing the answer, or<n><n># replace the variable with the string representing the answer.<n># <n><n># End program.<n><n># Initialize variable to "no"<n><n>answer=("no")<n><n># MC1<n><n>if answer=="yes"<n><n>	ans="yes"<n><n>else<n>	return("No")<n><n>## Instruction:answer the multiple choice<n><n>MC1={"no","yes"}<n><n>for i in MC1<n><n>	if i in answer<n><n>		answer=str(i)<n><n>	else<n><n>		return(ans)<n><n>## Instruction to print the answer<n><n>## Instruction<n><n>print(ans)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:The camper looked up at the vast night sky, it left him feeling mighty what? With some extra time, and money, you could even see the edge of our galaxy. This camp was perfect for you, it fit you like a glove. As you are looking out on the horizon, all is silent, but your tummy begins to gurgle, and the peace of your moment is gone. You then eat a pb&j that is waiting on you at the nearby picnic table. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where would you go if you didn't feel like baking a cake yourself? Give the number and two distinct digit values that form part this consecutive sequence.<n><n>a: 1 b: 55 c: 7999 d: 13 e: 5011719<n><n>The smallest non-prime number greater than x (where x is a natural number) is the solution!<n><n>Choices: a and 12903 a.k.a: 7998 and 7023<n><n># Question 2:<n><n>For each choice below, supply the integer (number), as well as two numbers (digits) that form part of the consecutive (consecutive: the order of two or more numbers in which one number is followed by the other)
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:An electronics store had things damaged from the rain, where should these things be stored? Choices:  A: large city B: strip mall C: building D: shopping mall E: aquarium<n>Output:		An electronics store is used to selling things. These things would be stored in  a store.<n><n>Input:Find the area of a triangle with sides of 6in, 9 in and 13in<n>Output: The area of the triangle is 81cm.<n>  <n>Input: A man has 120 books that weigh the same and 56 books that weigh four times as much as the others,  with the rest being twice as heavy as the others.How many books are there?<n>Output: 120+56 =276 books.So total books = 276<n><n>In what city is the Grand Central Station located? Choices: 1) New York City 2) Atlanta 3) Philadelphia<n>Output: 1) New york city<n><n>Input: The population of a small town in 1820 was about ____ people, and the population of the city of Pittsburgh is approximately ____ people.<n>Population in 1825 = <<>>11,000<n>Output: The population of the small town =1 11,00<n>The population of the city of pittsburg is <<>>126,000<n><n>Input: What color is the table? Choices: A: black, B: brown, C: green, D: red, E: white<n>Output: The color of the table in the photo is white.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What would release energy, but not mainly in your muscles? Choices:  A: vent B: think C: shouting D: work off E: exercise<n>Output:		A: Release<n><n>Input:You have a piece of graph paper and you draw a square the side equal to 1 centimeter on each side. Choices: A: b B: w C: s D: a E: none of the previous answers<n>Output: The answer is "w", "sss" is 4 letters and "ssss" is 5 letters.<n><n>Input: What is 4/8 + 8/8? Choices: A 5/8 B 7/8 C 15/8 D 9/8 E none of the above<n>Output: The answer to the question is 9/8 and the correct answer is B=7/8<n><n>Input: What's 4/1 - 9? Choices: A) nothing<n>B) -10<n>C) 5<n>D) 4<n>E) none of the above<n><n>Output: The answer the correct answer is D) 4<n><n><n># Explanations<n><n>The first question has two inputs: the difference in ages between two people and the age of one of the people.  From that, we can determine the age of the other person in the future.<n><n>The next question seems to require an answer of the letter B, but really it doesn't have the answer, it requires an answer of "any amount."<n><n>The water spout question requires an answer of Florida, and asks us to not write banana, but rather 2nd (spelled with a B), so banana (two times).<n><n>The three letter word question has two options, w and a.  Given this, it stands to reason that w is correct here, because three words becomes longer than 2 with the letters "w" in place of the "a"s.<n><n>And the division question has answer choices as multiples of eight, while the only option with a fraction has a fraction with a

Choices:  A: corrupt B: applied C: dirty D: contaminated E: fresh<n>Output:		The answer is C<n><n>Input: If the function is correct, the value output should be correct, but if the function is wrong, the output is incorrect. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What do you need to have before buying products? Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n>Output:		You can only buy products if you already have money and time. Once you are ready to buy, go ahead and pick the item you want<n><n>Input: If 3 times 3 equals 9 and 9 times 3 equals 27, what will 3 times 9 equal? Choices: A: 27. B: 30. C: 27. D: 36. E: 9<n>Output: if 3 times 3 is 9 and 9 x 3 is 27 then 3 times 9 will be 27.So option c is the correct answer<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What happens when humans are exposed to noises? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:A large container was a dime a dozen, there were hundreds of rows of them in the giant what? Choices:  A: factory B: garden C: supermarket D: garage E: warehouse<n>Output:		A: factory (there were hundreds of rows in the factory)<n><n>Input:The amount of people going to the grocery store per one hundred people is 20. How many people went to the grocery shopping per two people?<n>Output:30<n>If the amount of people going to grocery store per 100 people is 20, then the amount of people going groceries store per 2 people would be 20/2 = <<20/2=10>>10.<n>So 3 people went grocery shopping<n><n>Input:A number is subtracted by itself three times and then the subtraction of the three times of subtracting is 1000. Then what is 4 times a number? Answer choices: A: 256 B: 1024 C: 4096 D: 8192 E: 16384<n>Output:A: 256<n>A number subtracted by itself three time gets 1000<n>Then subtract 1000 three times<n>1000 - 1000 = 0<n>0 - 10 = 10<n>-10 = 16<n>Then 16 * the number = 256<n><n>Input:The sum of the digits of 216 is:<n>Output:13<n>216 = <<2+1+6=<<9=1>><n><n>Input:Two and two are added to equal five, how many plus two plus two is eleven?<n>Output:2=1<n>Answer to each question is unique.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:There was a saucepan used only for marinara, where was it kept? Choices:  A: georgia B: the south pole C: kitchen cupboard D: italian restaurant E: boil eggs<n>Output:		C<n><n>Input:You got a new computer and a new set of headphones, which is better?Choices:A: New headphones B: Old computer C: New computer D: Old headphones E: Old headphones<n>Output:D<n><n>#import the following two libraries<n>from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfVectorizer<n>from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression<n><n><n>#import numpy as np<n>#from gensim.models.keyedvectors import LdmKeyedVectors<n>#import cv2 <n><n><n>#load the data <n>with open('file1.txt') as fil1:<n>    data = [line.strip().split('\t') for line in fil1]<n><n><n>#create a dictionary containing the data<n>dataSets = dict(data)<n>print(dataSets)<n><n>#count the rows and column for the data<n>print("There are ", len(dataSets.values()),'rows and ', len(dataSets),'columns')<n><n><n>#separate the dictionary into sub lists of 10 for the purpose of training<n>len1 = len(dataSets) // 10<n><n>dataTrainingSet = []<n>for index in range(0, len1, 1):<n>    dataTrainingSet.append(dataSets[index])<n><n><n>#change the list of dicts to a list of the values inside each dict<n>dataTrainingSetValues = list(dataTrainingSet)<n><n>#set the list of values apart to a training set<n>trainingDataSetName = dataTrainingSetValues[13]<n><n>#create the tfidf vectorizer using the training set<n>tfidfVectorizer = TfidfVectorizeropt2()<n>tfidfVector = tfidfVectorizer.fit_transform(trainingDataSetName)<n><n><n>#create the model<n>modelLog = LogisticRegression.new_vectorizer()<n><n>#fit the model then save<n>modelLog.fit(tfidfVector)<n><n><n>#predict the output on the testing data<n>print('predict ', modelLog.predict([trainingDataSetName]), 'the outcome is:', modelLog.predict([dataTrainingSetValues[2]]) )<n><n>#read the data into a list<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:The small cabin was not available, so they were upgraded to what? However, the highest year that the game of baseball existed cannot be the problem, because it could be as recent as 1977<n><n>### Explain your program.<n>The way I created this problem is by using some simple math. I started by finding the minimum of all the years of existence for the MLB from <<1890 in 1969, because it is the lowest from the list>> 1890 to 2021. I then found the maximum of <<20 in 2021, because, as I said, the year 2020 didn't have a World Series and 1976 was the last year that a World Series was played before the pandemic>> 1977, because the year 1976 had no World Series either. Finally, I subtracted the two numbers and found [[2020 in 21, because the year 2019 didn't have a world series due to the world series during the normal year<<2020, so 2018-2021=the first year it was played in 1890, which is the year baseball started, so 2020-

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What could you put a table in if you want the table to be in your house? Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n>Output:		There are many different types of tables, but they are all commonly placed in the house. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:James was cooking s stew in his apartment kitchen. Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n>Output:		Deflation will occur which has the following effect on the quantity of money.<n><br><br>The quantity of money will fall since people buy less<n><br>and sell assets on the market. This will occur because people pay<n><br>lower prices for goods they desire.<n><br><img style="float:left; width: 806px; height:458px" src="https://d2e70e9yapps6cq.cloudfront.net/img/challenges/757eafcd-fca2-4cae-b7f5-5067f15b32dc.jpg" alt="" class="wysiwyg" id="fig_image_3"></img><n><n>Output: Choice D is the answer<n><n>Input: What is the largest number which is greater than all its prime factors? E: n(n-1)<n>Output: The answer E is correct which states as: n(n-)<n><n>![image](../1.png)<n><n>The following table contains a series of four binary numbers and their decimal representations converted into a hexadecimal number. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:We do not have rest, so how are we feeling? Choices:  A: exhausted B: lonely C: worked all day D: were very tired E: feel better<n>Output:		We have a ton of rest!!. But since the time of the interview we have been working we were very tired, but now we are feeling much better because we actually have the weekend to rest, so the answer should be either A,B or D<n>### Instruction Answer Question with explanation<n><n> Input: The difference between Richard and Hurley’s ages is 7. If Hurley is four years old, how old are Richard and Hurley 10 years from now? <n>Output:If the difference in the two ages is 7, and Hurley is four years, then Hurley, for a seven year old, should have a difference (7-4) = <<(7-4)=3>>3 more years until he is seventeen years old.<n>Richards age should be 7+3=<<7+3=10>>10, so to get their combined ages we add both numbers together = 10+10<n>Output:If the combined ages are 20, what is the difference in their ages?<n>Answer: Hurley is 8 years old, and Richard is 12 years old. <n>Input: John is 5 times as old as Emily. In 3 years John<n>will be twice as old as Emily is now. What is Emily’s age?<n>Output:If John is 5 times (5x) Emily's age, and John is 3 more years older, by the end of John's 3rd year John will be 2 (2) years older than the 3 years he had added to their age. John will be >>6>>6 years older than Emily, so in a mathematical equation 2 is divided by 6; therefore 3 years plus 6 years gives you the answer - 9 years old.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:The kids had been having fun all day, there was now a what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:A strong laxative will help you keep what kind of bowel movements? Choices:  A: strongwoman B: cake C: regular D: weak E: fragile<n>Output:		Choices:  C: regular<n><n>The output of this MCQ will be <n>[['C','regular'], ['A','strong woman'], ['D', 'weak'], ['B', 'cake'], ['E', 'fragile']]<n><n>### Tests are in:<n><n>tests/inputs-test.py<n>tests/output-test.py<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>##### Multiple Choice Questions<n>When you want to input answers of MCQ as string, use the below given format.<n><n>````python<n>question = '''<n>Input: A strong laxative will keep you from keeping what kind of bowel movement?<n>Choices:  <n>       A: strongwoman<n>       B: cake<n>       C: regular<n>       D: weak<n>       E: fragile<n><n>Please enter your answer as a string:<n>'''.strip()<n><n>output = '''<n>Please give the answer as a string<n>'''.strip()    <n>````
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n>Output:		A<n>C is not correct answer so the answer will be B.<n>B is also not correct answer so answer will be C.<n>Now C is correct answer so answer will B.<n>B is not correct answer so answer is A.<n>So the final answer will be A<n><n>Input:What is the capital of England? Choices: A: London B: Scotland C: Ireland D: North America E: Canada<n>Output:A<n>B is not correct, so A answer will be used, so answer will be A<n>B is not correct so answer will be A.<n>C is not correct so answer is A.<n>So the answer will be A.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:A shark swam in the background aquarium as the card players sat emotionless, what were they playing? Choices:  A: sea world B: court room C: shallow waters D: poker game E: card shark<n>Output:		A card shark is either an anglerfish, houndfish, trivia card player, or otherwise.

Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n>Output:		The options are (C) and (E), (D) says that you're not sorry but you won't accept the compliment with any sincerity. I have seen these choices so many times and they are not the best. If possible, if the answer is "none of the above" then the correct answer is (D) say that you're not thankful for the compliment, but you're not unwillingly taking it. They all include different responses.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where can you learn about operations with numbers? Choices:  A: math book B: phonebook C: statistic D: music school E: office<n>Output:		Choice b<n><n>### Difficulty:Hard<n><n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-  #<n># @Author: Xin Wang  <n># @Time : 2019/6/8 13:46  #<n><n>class MyInteger(object):<n>    x = 10<n><n>    def __init__(self, x=10):<n>        self.x = x<n><n>    def add(self, n):<n>        if type(n) is not int:<n>            return<n>        return self.x + n<n><n>    def sub(self, n): <n>        if type(x) is not int: <n>            return<n>        if n-self.x <0:<n>            return MyInteger(-self.x)<n>        return MyInteger(-self.(self.x - n))<n><n>    def multy(self, n):  <n>        if type(self.x) is not int or type(n) is  not int: <n>           return<n>       if (self.x%n ==0 and n>=1):<n>           return self+self.x/n<n>       else:<n>           return None        <n><n>    def div(self, n):   <n>        if type(MyInteger) is not int:   <n>           return None        	     <n>        if n%self.x==0 : <n>            return MyInteger(self.x/n)<n>        else: <n>            return None<n>print(MyInteger.x)<n>int_x = MyInteger.x<n>print(type(int_x))<n><n><n>input1 = int_x + 1<n><n>print(type(input1))<n>```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:james loved the stars. A:  yes B: no<n>Output: The answer is option B.<n><n>As the question states 12th level, so the answer is no.<n><n>Input: What is 70? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:The star had 4 rocky planets and 4 gaseous planets orbiting it, what was it part of Choices:  A: hollywood B: night sky C: constellation D: aliens E: solar system<n>Output:		The star had 8 planets orbiting it. So it was part of the Solar System<n><n>#Solutions<n>#Code:<n>#Part A<n>def diff_age(n,k):<n>    d=k<n>    while(d<n):<n>        d=d+1<n>    print(d,n)<n>    <n>def age(n,k):                <n>    if(k>n):<n>        k=k-difftime(k,n)<n>    q=k<n>    <n>    while(q>=0 and q<=n):<n>        #k=k-diffft(k,n)         <n>        print(k)<n>        q=q-2<n>    print("Age(=",k,")=",q)<n>       <n>import sys<n>def main():<n>        #Inputs<n>        n=int(raw_input())<n>        a=int(raw_time()-n)<n>        print "Age(=",a,")=",a+n<n>        #Outputs<n>        n=a+n<n>        print("Hurley will be, ",n)<n>        #Programming<n>        <n>    <n>if __name__=="__main__"_<n>	main()<n><n>#Part B<n>def age_b(n,k):   <n>    if(k>=n):<n>        n=n+k   <n>    else:<n>        if(k>=n+2):<n>        age_b(n+1,k-1)<n>        <n>    print("Age=",k)<n>if __name__ == "__main__"_    <n>	<n><n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What might a satisfied person do? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:If I wanted to store my chess pawn when I wasn't using it, what would be a good place for that? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:They don't get grades or sit at desks, but crowds of fish do what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n>Output:		Choice E: SkyE, Crash & Sky<n><n>### Step1:<n>```bash<n>#!/bin/bash<n>for ((i=0;i<$#;i++)); do<n>	read -r -p "Please press [Enter] to make your choice or [q] to exit and [n] to continue" input<n>        case $input in<n>        [n] | [N] ) break ;;<n>        [q] | [Q] ) break ;;<n>                * ) echo "Please follow the correct command!" ;;<n>        esac<n>done<n>echo "Good Bye~!"<n>echo "Press 'n' to keep, or 'q' to exit"<n>read -n 1 -r -p "Your choice : " nextInput<n>if [[ $nextInput = "q" ]]; then<n>        exit 0<n>fi<n>esac<n>```<n><n>### Step2<n>### A <n>```<n>if [[ $nextChoice == "a" ]]; then<n>echo "You Choose A"<n>	elif [[ $nextChoice == 'b' ]]; then<n>echo 'You Choose B'<n><n>else<n>	echo "The Choice Is Invalid"<n>fi<n><n>fi<n>```<n>### B <n>```<n>if ( [[ $prevChoice = "a" ]]) || if ( [[ $prevChoice == "b" ]]) then<n>	echo "You Choose B"<n>fi<n><n>if [[ $prevChoice == 'c' ]]; then<n>	echo "Invalid Choice"<n>fi<n>```<n><n>## Step3:<n>```bash<n>case $nextChoice in <n>["a"] | ["A"] ) echo "You Choose A";;<n>["b"] | ["B"] ) echo "You choose B";;<n>["c"] | ["C"] ) echo "You Chose c";;<n>["d"] | ["D"] ) echo "You chose D";;<n>["e"] | ["E"] ) echo "You choice E";;<n>["f"] | ["F"] ) echo "You choosed F";;<n>["g"] | ["G"] ) echo "You chosed G";;<n>["h"] | ["H"] ) echo "You chosen H";;<n>["i"] | ["I"] ) echo "You selected I";;<n>	esac<n><n>	else<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:John couldn't find a place to stay, and he didn't want to waste money.
