Why or why not. Choices:  A.  Yes, that is the only way<n>B.  No, it could not; there are no other ways that accelerations could occur.<n>C.  Only if the gravitational<n>force was equal both for the object and its field of gravitational<n>force.<n>Output:<n>This question appears to ask why objects do not accelerate simply by<n>becoming denser, but the answer should not be "No, it could not;<n>there are no other ways that acceleration could occur" which is a<n>statement of fact and not the conclusion of any argument (other<n>statements of fact that follow the conclusion are fine provided they<n>relate to the conclusions drawn and do not merely repeat the same<n>statement of fact already mentioned in the argument). Answer should be:<n>A. The force of gravity of an object is proportional to its mass,<n>therefore if an object has its own field of gravity then it is also its<n>own source of gravity.<n>B. This is not a reason why objects do not accelerated simply by becoming denser, it is only to<n>show the other ways that acceleration could appear.<n><n><a href= "https://i.stack-imgur.com/77HXr.png" rel="no index"><img class="alignnone" alt="Awosome Image #" src="https://i.imgur.com/7b6HQxC.png" width="500" height="500"/></a><n><n>## The answers of the following questions:<n><n>A. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:This city in Northern Norway is filled within things to do like Polar Nights half marathons and located in the middle of the Northern lights oval, which city is it? Choices:  A: northern B: nome C: tromsø D: finnmark E: vadsø<n>Output:		A and I am sorry to inform you that the first half marathon in the world took place in A: A, I am sorry to inform that the first half marathons in the world, took place in Tromsoe, a city in Northern Norway, the city of Tromsoe is filled within things to, do like Polar NIghts Half marathons and is located in the middle of Northern Lights Oval which is a circle around the North Pole.<n><n>Input: Which of these words are not an anagram of the others:  A. Lego<n>C. Geeko<n>D. Pizza<n>Output: Pizza and there is no anagram for those words.<n><n>Input: There are currently 19 teams with a positive winning percentage in the nba. the winning percentages of 4 randomly selected teams add up to the winning percentage of a fifth team that has the highest team winning percentage (in other words, the sum of the winning percentages of the four teams is greater than the winning percentage of the team with the high winning percantage) which is less than 55% a. which 4 teams are among the 19 with positive winning percentage<n>Output: The winning percentage of 5 randomly selected teams add up greater than the fifth team of the 19 with a winning percentage of 54 percent and is less than 54 percent, is less than 50 percent.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:The man tried to run, but he could not. Same as in the previous steps, add a new test case for third method in test_third_method.py,<n>2. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input:What is an way for people to meet with each other? The alphabet is not 5 characters long.<n><n>Input: 127, 114, 101, 88, 76, 64<n>Output: 76, 88,114,127,101,101<n><n>Input: What do we use a number system for?, Choices:  A. storing information B. making it possible for us to remember things C. to help us solve complex problems D. all of the above E. to make doing math faster.<n>Output: all of the above<n>```<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>> Python:<n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n>import sys <n><n>def getint(s):<n>    val = 0<n>    for i in range(len(s)):<n>        val = val * 2 + ord(s[i])<n>    return val<n>    <n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    for line in sys.stdin:<n>        line = line.strip()<n>        line = line[0];<n>        line = int('{0:05}'.format(line))<n>        if (line == 1):<n>            output = 'A'<n>        elif(line == 2):<n>            output ='B'<n>        elif( line == 3):<n>            output =  'C'<n>        elif (line == 4):<n>            output = "D: D is the largest letter."<n>        elif (line== 5):<n>            output ="E: E is not the largest letter."<n>```<n><n>### 1. A<n>Input: A, D, C, E are the largest letters.<n>Output: D, C, A, E, E<n><n>> Java:<n>```<n>public class Test0406 {<n><n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        int[] list = new int[10]; <n>        int max
